page.title: 05Pentlow
page.content: By the river - little Norman church with apse and round tower, beside the Hall with moat, bay window and oriel, and linenfold panels with merchant's mark; and the watermill. All beautiful On the high ground 1.5km away - the village. A four-cottage terrace, six semidet. council houses, twelve modern bungalows, eight modern detatched houses, former chapel and manse, large Old Rectory with Tower (a folly and landmark, memorial to the Rev. Bull). Population 182. School closed 1942, now Village Hall Village pump disused but still works Larks-in-the-Wood, remote farmhouse. Paine's Manor and Bower Hall, Tudor. The Pinkuah Arms - or The Pinkers - even old George Kemp whose father was publican doesn't know its meaning. George is probably a descendant of the Kempe family - big C17 tomb in church.
